page.title: 18Farming in Cupar
page.content: Farms situated to the north and east of Cupar are mixed arable and have an average size of 98 hectares. The main crop is barley. Other crops grown include oil seed rape, potatoes, turnips and soft fruits like strawberries, sold on a "pick your own" basis. Livestock consists mainly of beef cattle (no dairying) and sheep. The farms in this block are :- Hilton, Kinloss, Pittencrieff, Kingask, Middlefield, Foxton, Todhall, Newmill and Balass. This survey was compiled by fifth year History pupils at Bell Baxter High School, Cupar.
